title: Letters to the Editor:  Small Businesses Vary, and  Their Taxation Should Fit
text:
In "A Biden Tax-Hike Break For Small Businesses" (op-ed, Jan. 21), Ed Finn proposes that small businesses earning under $2.5 million a year should see no tax increase, but all companies earning above that number should be taxed at the full corporate rate, and the same should apply to subchapter S companies. This is far too simplistic. There are very small, small, medium, large and huge companies. Huge companies often have huge competitive advantages, especially over medium-size companies. If there is to be a difference in tax rates, they should be graduated like personal rates. A company earning $10 million a year and employing 400 employees should not be taxed at the same rate as Apple or Facebook.

Joel Myers

Founder & CEO

AccuWeather

State College, Pa.
